intro: Epilobium palustre var. sabulonense, commonly known as sandbank willowherb, is a flowering plant native to wetland and marshy habitats in North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the edges of water bodies. The plant features slender, erect stems that bear opposite, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are pink to purple, arranged in spikes, and bloom from June to August. It plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects and small animals.
